At least four Philippine Army soldiers of the 84th Infantry Battalion were confirmed dead in an encounter between government troops and the communist New People's Army (NPA) rebels in the remote Sitio (sub-village) of Bilongay in Barangay Paquet, Kasibu town area in southern Nueva Vizcaya on Friday (Sept 1). The fighting lasted from morning until noon. It was not reported if there were casualties among the communist rebels.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 1 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. The Philippine military said it has seized control of Bayabao Bridge in Banggolo. According to government sources, as of Sept 5 the ongoing military operations left at least 826 people dead - 636 militants, 145 government security forces and 45 civilians. (25 fatalities have been divided for the days from September 1 to September 5.)

A senior commander of the New People's Army Guerilla Front 53 surrendered on September 1 to the Army's 39th Infantry Battalion in a clandestine meeting in Arakan town in North Cotabato that Lumad elders and local officials brokered.

A series of air strikes launched by the Joint Task Force (JTF) Central in Maguindanao province killed at least 10 bandits belonging to the outlawed Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) over the weekend of September 2 and September 3. An undetermined number of BIFF fighters was wounded. (5 fatalities recorded for each day since it is not clear when and where they occurred.)

The military refutes the claims.

Air Force planes supported the ground assault with a series of air strikes.

No casualties were reported from the government side but an undetermined number of NPA rebels was killed. (Unknown fatalities coded as 3)

Five to seven unidentified men in black shirts fired automatic rifles and grenades at a detachment of Bravo Company of the Army's 65th Infantry Battalion in Bayang, Lanao del Sur on Wednesday (Sept 20), no injuries reported.

Government troops killed nine New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas in a clash that lasted more than two hours in Barangay Burgos near the town of Carranglan early Wednesday (Sept 20). A soldier was wounded in the clash.

At least 8,000 protesters held a series of rallies across Manila on Thursday (Sept 21) to protest against Duterte's administration over extrajudicial killings and police abuses in relation to his drug war and martial-law threats. Supporters of Duterte also turned up in large numbers and held a counter protest. Pro- and anti-government protesters converged near Malacanang Palace in Manila. From the Mendiola Peace Arch, anti-Duterte groups marched to Rizal Park, where they joined demonstrators who had staged similar protests in other parts of Metro Manila.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 21 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. President Duterte visited Marawi City for the 5th time since the fighting started on May 23. According to government sources, as of Sept 23 the ongoing military operations left at least 887 people dead - 689 militants, 151 government security forces and 47 civilians. (9 fatalities have been divided among the days from Sept 21 to Sept 23.)

Protesters from various organizations in Davao region held a rally in Davao City on Thursday (Sept 21) to protest against Duterte's administration over extrajudicial killings and police abuses in relation to his drug war and martial-law in Mindanao.

Hundreds of protesters gathered in Sorsogon province on Thursday (Sept 21) to protest against Duterte's administration over extrajudicial killings and police abuses in relation to his drug war and martial-law threats.

17 September. The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 22 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Government troops captured the last stronghold of the militants, the Masiu Bridge and several buildings, at noon Friday. According to government sources, as of Sept 23 the ongoing military operations left at least 887 people dead - 689 militants, 151 government security forces and 47 civilians. (9 fatalities have been divided among the days from Sept 21 to Sept 23.)

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Barangay Banga 1 within Plaridel town on September 22.

The vice mayor of Roxas town in Oriental Mindoro province was shot dead by an unidentified assailant at Barangay (village) Dangay on Friday afternoon (Sept. 22). The police is investigating the motive behind the killing.

The military launched a pre-emptive artillery strike against Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters who were about to attack soldiers in a secluded barangay in Guindulungan town area, Maguindanao on September 22. Four BIFF members were confirmed injured in the artillery barrage.

Government troops of the 81st Infantry Battalion of the Army's 7th Infantry Division encountered 15 New People's Army (NPA) in a 30-minute firefight at Barangay Madarang, Salcedo town in Ilocos Sur province on Saturday afternoon (Sept 24). A soldier was wounded.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Three drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Cabanatuan, Nueva Ecija on 23 Sep 2017.

A former barangay chairman was killed and his companion wounded in an ambush by unidentified armed men in Barangay San Antonio, Roxas, Isabela shortly before midnight on Saturday (Sept 23). Police have yet to determine the motive for the killing.

Firefights between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), led by Imam Bongos, and personnel of the Army's 37th Infantry Battalion and 6th ID's 64th Division Reconnaissance Company spilled over to several villages in Guindulungan town area on Sept 23. There were no reports of casualties.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 23 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of Sept 23 the ongoing military operations left at least 887 people dead - 689 militants, 151 government security forces and 47 civilians. (9 fatalities have been divided among the days from Sept 21 to Sept 23.)

The Philippine navy gave intercepted and opened fire on a Vietnamese fishing vessel operating within the country's exclusive economic zone about 30 nautical miles west of Bolinao, Pangasinan on September 23 at dawn. Allegedly the fishing vessel had rammed the navy ship. Following the clash, the bodies of two dead Vietnamese were found aboard one of the fishing boat but it was not clear how the men died. Five other Vietnamese fishermen were arrested during the operation and turned over to the local police in Pangasinan.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 24 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of Sept 24 the ongoing military operations left at least 892 people dead - 694 militants, 151 government security forces and 47 civilians. (5 fatalities have been recorded for Sept 24.)

A retired police official and his son were killed in an ambush by unidentified assailants in front of a cockpit arena at Barangay Balon, Mariveles, Bataan Sept 24 afternoon. Police have yet to determine the motive for the killing.

Two alleged members of an armed group were killed while six others were arrested following an encounter with police officers in Barangay Pula, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija on Sunday (Sept 24). It was not clear whether the assailants were part of a militant or a criminal group.

A 13-year-old boy was shot dead shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men who allegedly mistook the victim for a drug suspect in Pasay City, Metro Manila on September 24 afternoon. The victim's brother was also slain in a drug-related killing early this year.

24 September. Government troops encountered New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas in the morning on September 24 when members of the 730th Combat Group of the Philippine Air Force took over a supposed rebel encampment on Mt. Banoy in Barangay (village) Talumpok Silangan, Batangas City. The firefight continued as government forces pursued the rebels. At least one suspected rebel was killed and an undetermined number of NPA soldiers were wounded.

A village councilor was killed while her husband was wounded in an ambush by unidentified men in Purok 4 Barangay Progreso, Carmen town, Bohol past 1 pm on Sunday (Sept 24). Police have yet to determine the motive for the killing.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 25 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. One soldier was killed and 13 others wounded on Monday. According to government sources, as of Sept 25 the ongoing military operations left at least 894 people dead - 695 militants, 152 government security forces and 47 civilians. (2 fatalities have been recorded for Sept 25.)

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at San Jose, Nueva Ecija on 25 Sep 2017.

Fighting between government troops and New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas continued on Monday (Sept 25) as soldiers conducted pursuit operations against rebels fleeing from the uphill Barangay (village) Talumpok Silangan, Batangas City. The Philippine Air Force also launched a series of airstrikes in the vicinity of Mt. Banoy in Barangay (village) Talumpok Silangan to thwart 'improvised explosive devices' possibly set up by the rebels. Hundreds of families were forced to leave their homes due to the ongoing fighting. No casualties were reported.

Arrests: An alleged leader of the outlawed Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) was arrested by police and military troopers at his hideout in Barangay Nabalawag, Midsayap town, North Cotabato on September 25 morning.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Naga, Camarines Sur on 25 Sep 2017.

Two persons, including a village chief, were killed while two others were wounded when unidentified armed men sprayed bullets at an unfinished building in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte on Monday afternoon (Sept 25). Police have yet to determine the motive for the killings.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Ligao, Albay on 26 Sep 2017.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 26 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of Sept 28 the ongoing military operations left at least 936 people dead - 736 militants, 153 government security forces and 47 civilians. (42 fatalities have been divided among the days from Sept 26 to Sept 28.)
Arrests: A team of police and soldiers arrested an alleged New People's Army (NPA) leader at Barangay Talisan in San Andres town in Quezon province shortly before midnight Tuesday (Sept 26).

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Two drug suspects were killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants at Daraga, Albay on 26 Sep 2017.

Fighting between government troops and New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas continued on Tuesday (Sept 26) as soldiers conducted pursuit operations against rebels fleeing from the uphill Barangay (village) Talumpok Silangan, Batangas City. The Philippine Air Force also launched a series of airstrikes in the vicinity of Mt. Banoy in Barangay (village) Talumpok Silangan to thwart 'improvised explosive devices' possibly set up by the rebels. No casualties were reported.

A village councillor was shot dead shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Barangay Mamplasan, Binan City, Laguna province on Tuesday morning (Sept 26). Police have yet to determine the motive for the killing but the victim was included in Barangay Zapote's 'watch list' for illegal drugs.

Three people, a businessman and two minors, were injured in a explosion by improvised explosive devices in Barangay Tausan, Hadji Mutammad area, Basilan on Tuesday (Sept 26). No one claimed responsibility for the blast.

An activist and member of Alyansa sa Mag-uuma sa Sidlakang Dabaw (Alliance of Farmers in Eastern Davao) or Almasid (Toto Lompaodan) was shot dead by a man allegedly connected with the army's 67th Infantry Battalion in Cateel town, Davao Oriental on Tuesday (Sept 26). The military denied any involvement in the killing.

The deputy police chief of Polomolok town was killed and five others wounded in an gun attack by unidentified armed men near a shopping mall in the municipal centre of Polomolok, South Cotabato province on September 26.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; ABS CBN
notes: A drug suspect and Chinese national was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants at Pasay, Metro Manila on 26 Sep 2017.

27 September. Members Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF), allied with the government, captured a Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) camp in Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo town, Maguindanao at 1 pm on Sept 27, following seven weeks of hostilities between MILF and BIFF. No casualties were reported.
Two drug suspects were killed during police raids at Malolos, Bulacan on 27 Sep 2017.

source: ABS CBN; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental on 27 Sep 2017.

A board member of the second district of Masbate province was gunned down by unidentified assailants in Barangay Kinamaligan, Masbate City on Wednesday afternoon (Sept 27). Police have yet to determine the motive for the killing.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Philippines); BIFF: Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters
notes: Four members of the outlawed Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) have reportedly been executed by their leader Esmael Abdulmalik assumed in Datu Salibo town area on September 27 or September 28, on suspicion of providing the military and the Moro Islamic Liberation Front with information that led to the MILF's takeover of a BIFF camp.

Four people - include a soldier, a police officer and two village officials - were injured in two successive explosions by improvised explosive devices early Wednesday (Sept 27) near the military's Division Training School in Semba village, Datu Odin Sinsuat municipality, Maguindanao province. The first improvised explosive device was reportedly placed in a garbage drop-off point which hit a soldier who was about to dispose of garbage. The second blast targeted a response team of security and village officials. No one claimed responsibility for the blasts but the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) is active in the region.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead shot dead in an vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Barangay Bagong Nayon, Antipolo City in Rizal on September 27 or September 28.

Abu Sayyaf militants abducted a municipal councilor at the boundary of Barangays Tagbak area and Timbangan, Indanan, Sulu on Wednesday night (Sept 27). He was again released on Nov 1 near the village of Buru in Talipao town.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 27 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of Sept 28 the ongoing military operations left at least 936 people dead - 736 militants, 153 government security forces and 47 civilians. Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked a construction site and burnt equipment owned by EM Cuerpo Builders Inc., contractor of the airport in Daraga, Albay on September 28. The NPA was reportedly demanding money, which the construction company could not afford to pay. No injuries reported.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked the 2nd Maneuver Platoon of the Albay Provincial Police in Barangay Bascaran, Daraga, Albay at around 8 pm on September 28. No casualties were reported on either side.
New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked an Army patrol base at Barangay Alobo, Daraga, Albay at around 7.30 pm on September 28. No casualties were reported on either side.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a police raid in Santa Maria town area in Bulacan on Sep 28.

The military on Thursday (Sept 28) launched air strikes on the unpopulated Balt Island on Lake Lanao, three kilometres from Bacolod Kalawi area, Lanao del Sur, after unidentified armed men were sighted there the day before. Navy personnel and elite policemen on boats tried to approach the island following a series of air strikes but they were met with volley of gunfire from automatic rifles and machine guns. The air strikes resumed after that. No casualty had been reported.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders

The military denied any involvement in the killing.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives

actor2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Civilian Volunteer Organization
notes: Suspected New People's Army rebels of the Front 73 disarmed village officials and members of the civilian volunteers organization in the uphill Barangay Tudok, T'boli, South Cotabato province on Sept 29 or Sept 30. No injuries reported.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 29 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. 13 Maute fighters and two soldiers were killed in separate gun battles in Marawi City on Friday afternoon. According to government sources, as of Sept 29 the ongoing military operations left at least 951 people dead - 749 militants, 155 government security forces and 47 civilians. (15 fatalities have been recorded for Sept 29.)

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas ambushed a contingent of marines in the outskirts of San Vicente area, Palawan early on September 29. Three soldiers were wounded.

source: Sunstar (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Davao City, Davao del Sur on 29 Sep 2017.
A Quezon prosecutor was shot dead by unidentified men on a motorcycle on September 29 morning in Infanta, Quezon. Police have yet to determine the motive for the killing.

Detonation: A roadside bomb packed with nails prematurely exploded along a stretch of a highway near the Tambunan Bridge in Barangay Tambunan, Guindulungan town area late Friday (Sept 29), causing panic among local residents. BIFF is suspected to have planted the bomb.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: Suspected New People's Army rebels ambushed a military convoy heading back to their detachment in San Vicente town area in Palawan province on September 30 morning. Three Marines were wounded.
A police officer was shot dead by unidentified armed men shot along the highway in Barangay Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela on September 30. The motive for the killing could be work related.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Mutia, Zamboanga del Norte on 30 Sep 2017.
Suspected New People's Army rebels killed a policeman in Barangay Poblacion within Monreal, Masbate province on September 30.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in (Community) Fairview, Barangay Central, Mati City, Davao Oriental on September 30.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect and his companion were shot dead shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men near in Barangay Bani, Bacarra, Ilocos Norte on September 30. Four other men were also injured in the attack.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on September 30 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. No new fatalities were reported for Sept 30.
